headline: Young people lack financial literacy. But older folks aren’t that much smarter.
summary: For older investors, every money-related decision can affect the size and safety of their nest egg.

headline: CrowdStrike shares drop on weak revenue guidance
summary: CrowdStrike reported better-than-expected results for the latest quarter but issued revenue guidance that missed estimates.

headline: Trump signs order imposing 50% tariffs for steel, aluminum. Why economists are dismayed.
summary: The White House said Tuesday that President Donald Trump has signed an executive order to double tariffs on imported steel and aluminum to 50% from 25%.

headline: Benadryl, Band-Aid parent says tariffs and late allergy season are hurting its business
summary: Kenvue Chief Executive Thibaut Mongon said the consumer continues to be under pressure.

headline: Elon Musk calls Trump tax bill an ‘abomination.’ Does he have the clout to stop it?
summary: The Tesla CEO is giving support to a number of Senate fiscal hawks.

headline: Default on your student loans? Trump will go after your tax refunds and wages, but not Social Security
summary: The Education Department won’t target the Social Security payments of defaulted student-loan borrowers for now, but is still moving forward to offset tax refunds and pursue wage garnishments.

headline: People are turning to Campbell’s as they cook more at home. But they’re turning away from its snack brands. Here’s why.
summary: The snacks division ‘has been negatively impacted by consumers cutting back on discretionary purchases, and, in our view, growing usage of GLP-1s,’ TD Cowen analysts say

headline: Here’s when following a congressional stock trade can give you an edge in the market
summary: While the average member of Congress isn’t a superstar investor and might be better off sticking to index funds, certain trades by U.S. lawmakers tend to have predictive power, according to a new report from Wolfe Research analysts.

headline: Here's what is driving Tuesday's stock rally — plus, an analyst comes to Eli Lilly's defense
summary: Every weekday, the Investing Club releases the Homestretch; an actionable afternoon update just in time for the last hour of trading.

headline: CrowdStrike vs. Palo Alto Networks — why Wall Street values these stocks so differently
summary: What the market is telling us is that investors are willing to pay much more for CrowdStrike's future earnings.
